title: Chinese Warplanes Lead Taiwanese to Think About What to Do in an Attack
sub_head: Residents of the self-ruled island are used to living in the shadow of an authoritarian regime, but rising tensions with China are stoking uncertainty for some
body:
TAIPEI—Since she was a child, Angela Ou has known to hide under a table and stay near a source of clean water if an earthquake strikes Taiwan. She is much less certain about how to respond to a Chinese attack.
“Where would you even hide?” the 23-year-old graduate student asked. “I don’t know.”
